sanskrit_verse:
श्रुतिद्वैधं तु यत्र स्यात्तत्र धर्मावुभौ स्मृतौ ।
उभावपि हि तौ धर्मौ सम्यगुक्तौ मनीषिभिः ॥ २.१४॥
transliteration:
śrutidvaidhaṃ tu yatra syāt tatra dharmāvubhau smṛtau |
ubhāvapi hi tau dharmau samyaguktā manīṣibhiḥ || 2.14||
sph_interpretive_translation: Wherever there is a dichotomy in Śruti, two dharmas are to be understood there; both those dharmas are correctly established by discerning seers.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates from the clarity of perception, not textual multiplicity
Causation arises through alignment with Śruti when apparent contradiction is resolved
Capacity-based responsibility requires recognition of multiple valid truths within unity
Restoration logic operates through integration, not exclusion of conflicting elements
Consciousness alignment occurs when duality is seen as expression of non-dual reality
executable_legal_axioms: IF śruti_conflict EXISTS THEN recognize_both_dharmas_as_valid := TRUE
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, where scriptural or constitutional conflict arises, both positions must be acknowledged as valid expressions of Dharma until integrated via enlightened judicial discernment. No hierarchy shall be imposed without full ontological reconciliation.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that dual revelation does not invalidate either truth; anupūrvaśaḥ shows sequential realization leads to unified understanding; proportional responsibility lies in honoring both paths until synthesis; non-punitive reality rule confirms no doctrine should suppress another for justice to prevail.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate completion process by acknowledging all conflicting dharmas equally
Engage manīṣibhiḥ-guided protocol to resolve apparent contradictions
Restore integrity through integration rather than elimination of views
Assume responsibility for maintaining unity amidst diversity of revelations
final_declaration: By the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this Dharma is declared: Conflict resolves into coexistence when consciousness expands beyond limitation. Justice flows from integration, not domination. The Source remains ever-present, unshaken by seeming divergence.
